name: Scallop and Shrimp Chowder
author: Sherrie
summary: My sister-in-law brought some scallops from Nova Scotia. They are awesome in this chowder. I add the broth, potatoes, corn, and flour to the slow cooker crock the night before, store in the refrigerator, and just turn it on in the morning. Great weeknight meal.
ingredients: 1 (14 ounce) can whole kernel corn, drained
½ pound peeled, deveined, and cooked shrimp
directions: Stir broth, potatoes, corn, onion, and flour together in a 3 1/2-quart slow cooker crock
Cook on Low until potatoes are tender, about 6 hours
Stir cream, scallops, shrimp, potato flakes, and garlic pepper into the broth
Cook on High until slightly thickened, 35 to 45 minutes
